parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value: This software depends whole-heartedly on the work done by all original and current authors of OneMap. We therefore ask you to cite both OneMap and BatchMap if you find BatchMap useful in your research.
Fork of OneMap for fast computation of high density linkage maps

result.original_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value:
BatchMap is a fork of the [OneMap](https://github.com/augusto-garcia/onemap) software package for the construction of linkage maps.
Specifically it aims to provide a framework that enables creating linkage maps from dense marker data (N>10,000). 
Most of the non-core functionality of OneMap has been stripped and only a few functions are left at user-level. Further, this package is typically expected to be run on a headless server due to memory requirements, so all graphic functionality has also been removed.

Windows is currently not able to parallelize R code using the `parallel` package. It is therefore **highly** recommended to use the docker container [here](https://hub.docker.com/r/bschiffthaler/batchmap/).
BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value:
This will install the current development version, which is newest, but might include unstable code. If you're in doubt, install from CRAN.

```R
install.packages("devtools")
library(devtools)
install_github("bschiffthaler/BatchMap")
```

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value:
~This installs the latest stable version.~

The package on CRAN is deprectaed. Please install from GitHub or use the Docker container.

Windows is currently not able to parallelize R code using the `parallel` package. It is therefore **highly** recommended to use the docker container [here](https://hub.docker.com/r/bschiffthaler/batchmap/).

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value: The twopoint table of recombination fractions and likelihoods will take `4 * 8 * N * N bytes` in memory, where `N` is your marker number. If you have anything less than that, you need to either reduce the number of input markers, or rent a cloud server (Amazon EC2 provides high memory machines).

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value: BatchMap employs a divide and conquer algorithm that manages to speed up the calculation of high density datasets and - additionally - scales well with higher marker numbers. It further features a routine inspired by OneMap's `ripple.seq` function that can adaptively reorder windows of markers to improve the order of sequences.

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value: BatchMap is created specifically for F1 outcrossing populations. If your data is not that (e.g. backcross, F2, RIL), use [OneMap](https://github.com/augusto-garcia/onemap).

parent_header: BatchMap - A parallel implementation of the OneMap R package for fast computation of F1 linkage maps in outcrossing species
result.value: After installation, you can read the user tutorial ('vignette') [here](https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/bschiffthaler/BatchMap.html).
